PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_CoaxialCable
PropertySetDef.Definition: Properties applicable to a coaxial cable, which is a copper cable with a variable number of copper coaxial pair conductors used to transmit data by means of electrical signals, especially at radio frequency. This property set is applicable to a type or occurence of IfcCableSegment with predefined type CABLESEGMENT.

PropertyDef.Name: CharacteristicImpedance
PropertyDef.Definition: A quantity defined for a mode of propagation at a given frequency in a specific uniform transmission line or uniform waveguide by one of the three following relations: Z1 = S/ |I|2 Z2 = |U|2 / S Z3 = U / I where Z is the complex characteristic impedance, S the complex power and U and I are the values, usually complex, respectively of a voltage and a current conventionally defined for each type of mode by analogy with transmission line equations.

PropertyDef.Name: CouplingLoss
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates the coupling loss of a leaky coaxial cable (radiating cable).

PropertyDef.Name: MaximumTransmissionAttenuation
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates the Maximum transmission attenuation of feeder.

PropertyDef.Name: NumberOfCoaxialPairs
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates the total number of coaxial pairs in the coaxial cable.

PropertyDef.Name: TransmissionLoss
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates the transmission loss of the leaky coaxial cable (radiating cable).

PropertyDef.Name: RadiantFrequency
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates the radiant frequency of the leaky coaxial cable (radiating cable).
